job_description_html:
Description

About us:

Gable.ai is a Seattle-based startup revolutionizing the data industry. Through our data communication, change management, and collaboration platform, we empower developers to build and manage data assets, bridging the gap between data producers and consumers to upscale data quality. Fresh out of stealth mode and backed by prominent venture partners, our mission is to reshape data management by fostering collaboration and innovation. Join us in transforming the landscape of the data industry!

As a Static Code Analysis Expert at Gable.ai , you will be at the forefront of developing and integrating static code analysis tools that are core to our product offerings. Your role will involve designing, implementing, and maintaining static analysis tools and features that help improve the quality, security, and maintainability of our clients' codebases. You will work closely with our engineering team to integrate these tools seamlessly into our platform.

Responsibilities:

  • Tool Development: Design, develop, and implement static code analysis tools and features as part of the Gable.ai product.
  • Integration: Collaborate with the engineering team to integrate static analysis tools into the Gable.ai platform, ensuring they work efficiently with existing systems.
  • Code Analysis: Create algorithms and techniques to analyze code for potential issues such as bugs, performance issues, and code smells.
  • Automation: Develop automated processes to run static code analysis as part of the CI/CD pipelines.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, software engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver effective static analysis solutions.
  • Continuous Improvement: Continuously improve the static code analysis tools based on feedback, industry trends, and advancements in the field.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of the static analysis tools, processes, and best practices.
  • Training: Provide training and support to internal teams and clients on how to effectively use the static code analysis tools.

Requirements

  • Experience: Proven experience in developing and integrating static code analysis tools, preferably in a startup or high-growth environment.
  • Technical Skills:
  • Programming Languages: Strong proficiency in Javascript, Typescript, and Python.
  • Static Analysis Tools: Experience with tools such as SonarQube, ESLint, PyLint, and similar.
  • CI/CD: Familiarity with CI/CD tools and pipelines, such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions.
  • Problem-Solving: Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to develop innovative solutions to complex technical challenges.
  • Communication: Strong communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

Tech Stack:

  • Python
  • Spark
  • Kafka
  • Snowflake
  • PostgreSQL
  • MySQL
  • MongoDB
  • dbt
  • Modern Data Stack
  • Data Quality
  • Data Observability

Benefits

  • Be part of a pioneering team that is redefining the data industry.
  • Work on cutting-edge technology with the opportunity to make a significant impact.
  • Collaborate with a talented and passionate team of engineers and industry experts.
  • Enjoy a dynamic, fast-paced, and supportive work environment.
  • Competitive compensation package and benefits.

If you are passionate about the intersection of software engineering and data, and eager to contribute to the future of data management and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Gable.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and encourages applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

Apply for this job

## Description

**About us:**

Gable.ai is a Seattle-based startup revolutionizing the data industry. Through our data communication, change management, and collaboration platform, we empower developers to build and manage data assets, bridging the gap between data producers and consumers to upscale data quality. Fresh out of stealth mode and backed by prominent venture partners, our mission is to reshape data management by fostering collaboration and innovation. Join us in transforming the landscape of the data industry!

As a Static Code Analysis Expert at
[Gable.ai](http://gable.ai/)
, you will be at the forefront of developing and integrating static code analysis tools that are core to our product offerings. Your role will involve designing, implementing, and maintaining static analysis tools and features that help improve the quality, security, and maintainability of our clients' codebases. You will work closely with our engineering team to integrate these tools seamlessly into our platform.

**Responsibilities:**

* Tool Development: Design, develop, and implement static code analysis tools and features as part of the
  [Gable.ai](http://gable.ai/)
  product.
* Integration: Collaborate with the engineering team to integrate static analysis tools into the
  [Gable.ai](http://gable.ai/)
  platform, ensuring they work efficiently with existing systems.
* Code Analysis: Create algorithms and techniques to analyze code for potential issues such as bugs, performance issues, and code smells.
* Automation: Develop automated processes to run static code analysis as part of the CI/CD pipelines.
* Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, software engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver effective static analysis solutions.
* Continuous Improvement: Continuously improve the static code analysis tools based on feedback, industry trends, and advancements in the field.
* Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of the static analysis tools, processes, and best practices.
* Training: Provide training and support to internal teams and clients on how to effectively use the static code analysis tools.


## Requirements

* Experience: Proven experience in developing and integrating static code analysis tools, preferably in a startup or high-growth environment.
* Technical Skills:
* Programming Languages: Strong proficiency in Javascript, Typescript, and Python.
* Static Analysis Tools: Experience with tools such as SonarQube, ESLint, PyLint, and similar.
* CI/CD: Familiarity with CI/CD tools and pipelines, such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions.
* Problem-Solving: Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to develop innovative solutions to complex technical challenges.
* Communication: Strong communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

**Tech Stack:**

* Python
* Spark
* Kafka
* Snowflake
* PostgreSQL
* MySQL
* MongoDB
* dbt
* Modern Data Stack
* Data Quality
* Data Observability


## Benefits

* Be part of a pioneering team that is redefining the data industry.
* Work on cutting-edge technology with the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* Collaborate with a talented and passionate team of engineers and industry experts.
* Enjoy a dynamic, fast-paced, and supportive work environment.
* Competitive compensation package and benefits.

If you are passionate about the intersection of software engineering and data, and eager to contribute to the future of data management and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Gable.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and encourages applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.



[Apply for this job](/gable/j/1A48FFBF3B/apply/)

job_description_html:
Description

About Us:

Gable.ai is a Seattle-based startup revolutionizing the data industry. Through our data communication, change management, and collaboration platform, we empower developers to build and manage data assets, bridging the gap between data producers and consumers to upscale data quality. Fresh out of stealth mode and backed by prominent venture partners, our mission is to reshape data management by fostering collaboration and innovation. Join us in transforming the landscape of the data industry!

Responsibilities:

As a Senior Software Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be to own design and delivery of full stack product features. A key component of your work will be to scope out and build the best-possible data solutions to green-field problems at scale. This includes working directly with customers to define the problem, shortlisting tools and technologies, implementing and validating production grade software, evaluation, and deployment.

You'll build key product features with direct impact on company success. You'll work closely with customers to understand their problems and requirements. You'll focus on generalizing your work and building abstractions that improve a variety of integration with common data stack oriented technologies.

Requirements

  • You have minimum 5 years of writing production grade software, ideally with experience at a B2B SaaS company
  • Experience with a modern object-oriented language such as Python, Go and Java
  • You’re excited about being cross-functional and owning the lifecycle of building novel solutions to complex problems — from development to deployment.
  • You stay up-to-date with the latest developments in your area of interest in both software development and the data space. You’re comfortable reading technical papers and documentation, and reproducing the results in a production environment.
  • You’ve previously worked with a variety of backend technologies, including Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/Pulumi),  relational databases and NoSQL databases, and modern API frameworks.
  • You’re really excited about solving the biggest challenges in the modern data stack and building applications that leverage these technologies for solving complex data problems.
  • You enjoy fast-paced environments and exhibit a high degree of ownership and self-sufficiency. Unstructured environments are exciting to you because they represent opportunities for growth and leadership.

Tech Stack:

  • TypeScript
  • Python
  • Node
  • Postgres
  • AWS
  • Snowflake

Benefits

  • Be part of a pioneering team that is redefining the data industry.
  • Work on cutting-edge technology with the opportunity to make a significant impact.
  • Collaborate with a talented and passionate team of engineers and industry experts.
  • Enjoy a dynamic, fast-paced, and supportive work environment.
  • Competitive compensation package and benefits.

If you are passionate about the intersection of software engineering and data, and eager to contribute to the future of data management and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Gable.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and encourages applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

Apply for this job

## Description

**About Us:**

Gable.ai is a Seattle-based startup revolutionizing the data industry. Through our data communication, change management, and collaboration platform, we empower developers to build and manage data assets, bridging the gap between data producers and consumers to upscale data quality. Fresh out of stealth mode and backed by prominent venture partners, our mission is to reshape data management by fostering collaboration and innovation. Join us in transforming the landscape of the data industry!

**Responsibilities:**

As a Senior Software Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be to own design and delivery of full stack product features. A key component of your work will be to scope out and build the best-possible data solutions to green-field problems at scale. This includes working directly with customers to define the problem, shortlisting tools and technologies, implementing and validating production grade software, evaluation, and deployment.

You'll build key product features with direct impact on company success. You'll work closely with customers to understand their problems and requirements. You'll focus on generalizing your work and building abstractions that improve a variety of integration with common data stack oriented technologies.



## Requirements

* You have minimum 5 years of writing production grade software, ideally with experience at a B2B SaaS company
* Experience with a modern object-oriented language such as Python, Go and Java
* You’re excited about being cross-functional and owning the lifecycle of building novel solutions to complex problems — from development to deployment.
* You stay up-to-date with the latest developments in your area of interest in both software development and the data space. You’re comfortable reading technical papers and documentation, and reproducing the results in a production environment.
* You’ve previously worked with a variety of backend technologies, including Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/Pulumi),  relational databases and NoSQL databases, and modern API frameworks.
* You’re really excited about solving the biggest challenges in the modern data stack and building applications that leverage these technologies for solving complex data problems.
* You enjoy fast-paced environments and exhibit a high degree of ownership and self-sufficiency. Unstructured environments are exciting to you because they represent opportunities for growth and leadership.

**Tech Stack:**

* TypeScript
* Python
* Node
* Postgres
* AWS
* Snowflake


## Benefits

* Be part of a pioneering team that is redefining the data industry.
* Work on cutting-edge technology with the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* Collaborate with a talented and passionate team of engineers and industry experts.
* Enjoy a dynamic, fast-paced, and supportive work environment.
* Competitive compensation package and benefits.

If you are passionate about the intersection of software engineering and data, and eager to contribute to the future of data management and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Gable.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and encourages applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

job_description_html:
Description

About Us:

Gable.ai is a Seattle-based startup revolutionizing the data industry. Through our data communication, change management, and collaboration platform, we empower developers to build and manage data assets, bridging the gap between data producers and consumers to upscale data quality. Fresh out of stealth mode and backed by prominent venture partners, our mission is to reshape data management by fostering collaboration and innovation. Join us in transforming the landscape of the data industry!

Responsibilities:

As a Sr. ML Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be to own end-to-end machine learning projects. You will be tasked with designing, developing, and deploying high-performance ML models to solve complex, green-field problems at scale. This includes defining use cases, curating and engineering large-scale datasets, selecting appropriate tools and technologies, building and validating production-grade models, and optimizing them for cost, performance, and latency. You will be integral to ensuring that our ML solutions are robust, scalable, and impactful from ideation through to deployment and evaluation.

  • Conduct thorough analysis of data to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to generate lineage graphs, predict dataflows, identify break code challenges
  • Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms to build ML & AI deployments ground-up, 0 → 1
  • Responsible for LLM integration focused on producing human readable interpretations of analysis results
  • Build traditional ML models from the ground up to power core pieces of our product

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as a ML engineer or Data Scientist- ideally at an early stage or high growth startup - specializing in machine learning algorithms
  • Past experience building algorithms from 0 → 1 and an entrepreneurial mindset
  • Proven experience in building and deploying machine learning models in the context of search ranking or recommendation systems.
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
  • Proficiency in working with large datasets, data preprocessing, and feature engineering.
  • Knowledge of information retrieval, natural language processing, and ranking algorithms.
  • Ability to work cross functionally with growth, engineering, product, and an executive team
  • Knowledge and experience in best practices in applying MLOps in an organization with an emphasis on continuous development and deployment.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.

Tech Stack:

  • TypeScript
  • Python
  • Node
  • Postgres
  • AWS
  • Snowflake

Benefits

Why Join Us:

  • Be part of a pioneering team that is redefining the data industry.
  • Work on cutting-edge technology with the opportunity to make a significant impact.
  • Collaborate with a talented and passionate team of engineers and industry experts.
  • Enjoy a dynamic, fast-paced, and supportive work environment.
  • Competitive compensation package and benefits.

If you are passionate about the intersection of software engineering and data, and eager to contribute to the future of data management and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Gable.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and encourages applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

Apply for this job

## Description

**About Us:**

Gable.ai is a Seattle-based startup revolutionizing the data industry. Through our data communication, change management, and collaboration platform, we empower developers to build and manage data assets, bridging the gap between data producers and consumers to upscale data quality. Fresh out of stealth mode and backed by prominent venture partners, our mission is to reshape data management by fostering collaboration and innovation. Join us in transforming the landscape of the data industry!

As a Sr. ML Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be to own end-to-end machine learning projects. You will be tasked with designing, developing, and deploying high-performance ML models to solve complex, green-field problems at scale. This includes defining use cases, curating and engineering large-scale datasets, selecting appropriate tools and technologies, building and validating production-grade models, and optimizing them for cost, performance, and latency. You will be integral to ensuring that our ML solutions are robust, scalable, and impactful from ideation through to deployment and evaluation.

* Conduct thorough analysis of data to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to generate lineage graphs, predict dataflows, identify break code challenges
* Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms to build ML & AI deployments ground-up, 0 → 1
* Responsible for LLM integration focused on producing human readable interpretations of analysis results
* Build traditional ML models from the ground up to power core pieces of our product


## Requirements

* 5+ years of experience as a ML engineer or Data Scientist- ideally at an early stage or high growth startup - specializing in machine learning algorithms
* Past experience building algorithms from 0 → 1 and an entrepreneurial mindset
* Proven experience in building and deploying machine learning models in the context of search ranking or recommendation systems.
* Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
* Proficiency in working with large datasets, data preprocessing, and feature engineering.
* Knowledge of information retrieval, natural language processing, and ranking algorithms.
* Ability to work cross functionally with growth, engineering, product, and an executive team
* Knowledge and experience in best practices in applying MLOps in an organization with an emphasis on continuous development and deployment.
* Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.

**Tech Stack:**

* TypeScript
* Python
* Node
* Postgres
* AWS
* Snowflake


## Benefits

Why Join Us:

* Be part of a pioneering team that is redefining the data industry.
* Work on cutting-edge technology with the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* Collaborate with a talented and passionate team of engineers and industry experts.
* Enjoy a dynamic, fast-paced, and supportive work environment.
* Competitive compensation package and benefits.

If you are passionate about the intersection of software engineering and data, and eager to contribute to the future of data management and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Gable.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and encourages applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

## Description

**About Us:**

Gable.ai is a Seattle-based startup revolutionizing the data industry. Through our data communication, change management, and collaboration platform, we empower developers to build and manage data assets, bridging the gap between data producers and consumers to upscale data quality. Fresh out of stealth mode and backed by prominent venture partners, our mission is to reshape data management by fostering collaboration and innovation. Join us in transforming the landscape of the data industry!

**Responsibilities:**

As a Staff Software Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be to own design and delivery of full stack product features. A key component of your work will be to scope out and build the best-possible data solutions to green-field problems at scale. This includes working directly with customers to define the problem, shortlisting tools and technologies, implementing and validating production grade software, evaluation, and deployment.

You'll build key product features with direct impact on company success. You'll work closely with customers to understand their problems and requirements. You'll focus on generalizing your work and building abstractions that improve a variety of integration with common data stack oriented technologies.



## Requirements

* You have minimum 8 years of writing production grade software, ideally with experience at a B2B SaaS company
* Experience with a modern object-oriented language such as Python, Go and Java
* You’re excited about being cross-functional and owning the lifecycle of building novel solutions to complex problems — from development to deployment.
* You stay up-to-date with the latest developments in your area of interest in both software development and the data space. You’re comfortable reading technical papers and documentation, and reproducing the results in a production environment.
* You’ve previously worked with a variety of backend technologies, including Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/Pulumi),  relational databases and NoSQL databases, and modern API frameworks.
* You’re really excited about solving the biggest challenges in the modern data stack and building applications that leverage these technologies for solving complex data problems.
* You enjoy fast-paced environments and exhibit a high degree of ownership and self-sufficiency. Unstructured environments are exciting to you because they represent opportunities for growth and leadership.

**Tech Stack:**

* TypeScript
* Python
* Node
* Postgres
* AWS
* Snowflake
* Rust


## Benefits

* Be part of a pioneering team that is redefining the data industry.
* Work on cutting-edge technology with the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* Collaborate with a talented and passionate team of engineers and industry experts.
* Enjoy a dynamic, fast-paced, and supportive work environment.
* Competitive compensation package and benefits.

If you are passionate about the intersection of software engineering and data, and eager to contribute to the future of data management and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Gable.ai is an equal-opportunity employer and encourages applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.



[Apply for this job](/gable/j/E176E721AD/apply/)

job_description_html:
Abridge was founded in 2018 with the mission of powering deeper understanding in healthcare. Our AI-powered platform was purpose-built for medical conversations, improving clinical documentation efficiencies while enabling clinicians to focus on what matters most—their patients.

Our enterprise-grade technology transforms patient-clinician conversations into structured clinical notes in real-time, with deep EMR integrations. Powered by Linked Evidence and our purpose-built, auditable AI, we are the only company that maps AI-generated summaries to ground truth, helping providers quickly trust and verify the output. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, we are setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.

We are a growing team of practicing MDs, AI scientists, PhDs, creatives, technologists, and engineers working together to empower people and make care make more sense.

The Role

As a Deal Desk Manager at Abridge, you will be pivotal in optimizing the sales process by managing and coordinating complex customer contracts and sales deals. Acting as the central liaison among sales, finance, and legal teams, you ensure that deals are structured to be compliant, profitable, and strategically aligned with the company's Go-To-Market objectives.

What You’ll Do

  • Become the expert in Abridge’s pricing models, products, and contract terms to assist our Commercial teams with deal structure, quoting, and revenue generation.

  • Own deal process and operations within our CRM (Salesforce), contract management software (Ironclad), and approvals process

  • Manage the deal approval process, ensuring efficient coordination and communication among key stakeholders such as finance, legal, and commercial departments to secure necessary endorsements and approvals.

  • Rigorously review deal proposals, pricing strategies, and contract terms to assess risks, opportunities, and compliance with operational standards.

  • Identify and implement improvements in the deal desk’s workflows, increasing efficiency and effectiveness.

  • Use analytical skills to optimize deal structures and discounting strategy for maximum profitability and alignment with strategic goals.

  • Collaborate with sales team members in identifying and mapping organizational structure for our customers to optimize our engagement strategy

  • Work closely with sales teams to advise on and refine deal structuring and negotiation tactics, leveraging a deep understanding of market dynamics and common legal constraints.

  • Maintain meticulous records of deal terms, approvals, and communications, safeguarding the company’s interests.

  • Empower and equip the sales team with the necessary knowledge and tools regarding deal desk processes through targeted training sessions.

  • Stay abreast of market trends, regulatory changes, and technological advancements that could impact deal structuring and sales strategies.

What You’ll Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field.

  • 4+  years of experience in a deal desk, sales operations, finance, or contracts/paralegal role, preferably in a SaaS/software environment.

  • Strong grasp of revenue recognition principles, financial modeling, and contract management.

  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

  • Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, build strong relationships and communicate persuasively to influence outcomes.

  • Proficiency in Salesforce CRM, Ironclad contract management, and other sales automation software.

  • Exceptional attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

  • Ability to work through ambiguity and positively respond to rapid change

  • Self-motivated and resourceful, able to work independently with minimal supervision.

Why Work at Abridge?

  • Be a part of a trailblazing, mission-driven organization that is powering deeper understanding in healthcare through AI!

  • Opportunity to work and grow with talented individuals and have ownership and impact at a high-growth startup.

  • Flexible/Unlimited PTO — Salaried team members can take off as much approved time off as they need, plus 13 paid holidays

  • Equity — For all salaried team members

  • Medical insurance — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 3 Aetna plans to choose from.

  • Dental & Vision insurance — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 2 Aetna plans to choose from.

  • Flexible Spending (FSA) & Health Savings (HSA) Accounts

  • Learning and Development budget — $3,000 per year for coaching, courses, workshops, conferences, etc.

  • 401k Plan — Contribute pre-tax dollars toward retirement savings.

  • Paid Parental Leave — 16 weeks paid parental leave, for all full-time employees

  • Flexible working hours — We care more about what you accomplish than what specific hours you’re working.

  • Home Office Budget — We provide up to $1,600 in a one-time reimbursement to set up your home office.

  • Sabbatical Leave — 30 days of paid Sabbatical Leave after 5 years of employment.

  • ...Plus much more!

Life at Abridge

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and helping each other be successful.

Diversity & Inclusion

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

Staying Safe - Protect Yourself From Recruitment Fraud

We are aware of individuals and entities fraudulently representing themselves as Abridge recruiters and/or hiring managers. Abridge will never ask for financial information or payment, or for personal information such as bank account number or social security number during the job application or interview process. Any emails from the Abridge recruiting team will come from an @ abridge.com email address. You can learn more about how to protect yourself from these types of fraud by referring to this article . Please exercise caution and cease communications if something feels suspicious about your interactions.

Compensation Range: $120K - $160K
job_description_md:
Abridge was founded in 2018 with the mission of powering deeper understanding in healthcare. Our AI-powered platform was purpose-built for medical conversations, improving clinical documentation efficiencies while enabling clinicians to focus on what matters most—their patients.

Our enterprise-grade technology transforms patient-clinician conversations into structured clinical notes in real-time, with deep EMR integrations. Powered by Linked Evidence and our purpose-built, auditable AI, we are the only company that maps AI-generated summaries to ground truth, helping providers quickly trust and verify the output. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, we are setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.

We are a growing team of practicing MDs, AI scientists, PhDs, creatives, technologists, and engineers working together to empower people and make care make more sense.

## **The Role**

As a Deal Desk Manager at Abridge, you will be pivotal in optimizing the sales process by managing and coordinating complex customer contracts and sales deals. Acting as the central liaison among sales, finance, and legal teams, you ensure that deals are structured to be compliant, profitable, and strategically aligned with the company's Go-To-Market objectives.

### **What You’ll Do**

* Become the expert in Abridge’s pricing models, products, and contract terms to assist our Commercial teams with deal structure, quoting, and revenue generation.
* Own deal process and operations within our CRM (Salesforce), contract management software (Ironclad), and approvals process
* Manage the deal approval process, ensuring efficient coordination and communication among key stakeholders such as finance, legal, and commercial departments to secure necessary endorsements and approvals.
* Rigorously review deal proposals, pricing strategies, and contract terms to assess risks, opportunities, and compliance with operational standards.
* Identify and implement improvements in the deal desk’s workflows, increasing efficiency and effectiveness.
* Use analytical skills to optimize deal structures and discounting strategy for maximum profitability and alignment with strategic goals.
* Collaborate with sales team members in identifying and mapping organizational structure for our customers to optimize our engagement strategy
* Work closely with sales teams to advise on and refine deal structuring and negotiation tactics, leveraging a deep understanding of market dynamics and common legal constraints.
* Maintain meticulous records of deal terms, approvals, and communications, safeguarding the company’s interests.
* Empower and equip the sales team with the necessary knowledge and tools regarding deal desk processes through targeted training sessions.
* Stay abreast of market trends, regulatory changes, and technological advancements that could impact deal structuring and sales strategies.

### **What You’ll Bring**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
* 4+  years of experience in a deal desk, sales operations, finance, or contracts/paralegal role, preferably in a SaaS/software environment.
* Strong grasp of revenue recognition principles, financial modeling, and contract management.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, build strong relationships and communicate persuasively to influence outcomes.
* Proficiency in Salesforce CRM, Ironclad contract management, and other sales automation software.
* Exceptional attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work through ambiguity and positively respond to rapid change
* Self-motivated and resourceful, able to work independently with minimal supervision.

## **Why Work at Abridge?**

* Be a part of a trailblazing, mission-driven organization that is powering deeper understanding in healthcare through AI!
* Opportunity to work and grow with talented individuals and have ownership and impact at a high-growth startup.
* **Flexible/Unlimited PTO**
  — Salaried team members can take off as much approved time off as they need, plus 13 paid holidays
* **Equity**
  — For all salaried team members
* **Medical insurance**
  — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 3 Aetna plans to choose from.
* **Dental & Vision insurance**
  — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 2 Aetna plans to choose from.
* **Flexible Spending (FSA) & Health Savings (HSA) Accounts**
* **Learning and Development budget**
  — $3,000 per year for coaching, courses, workshops, conferences, etc.
* **401k Plan**
  — Contribute pre-tax dollars toward retirement savings.
* **Paid Parental Leave**
  — 16 weeks paid parental leave, for all full-time employees
* **Flexible working hours**
  — We care more about what you accomplish than what specific hours you’re working.
* **Home Office Budget**
  — We provide up to $1,600 in a one-time reimbursement to set up your home office.
* **Sabbatical Leave**
  — 30 days of paid Sabbatical Leave after 5 years of employment.
* ...Plus much more!

## **Life at Abridge**

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and helping each other be successful.

## **Diversity & Inclusion**

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

## **Staying Safe - Protect Yourself From Recruitment Fraud**

We are aware of individuals and entities fraudulently representing themselves as Abridge recruiters and/or hiring managers. Abridge will never ask for financial information or payment, or for personal information such as bank account number or social security number during the job application or interview process. Any emails from the Abridge recruiting team will come from an @
[abridge.com](http://abridge.com)
email address. You can learn more about how to protect yourself from these types of fraud by referring to
[this article](https://consumer.ftc.gov/consumer-alerts/2023/05/scammers-are-hijacking-job-ads-heres-how-spot-fakes)
. Please exercise caution and cease communications if something feels suspicious about your interactions.

Compensation Range: $120K - $160K

Powered by Linked Evidence and our purpose-built, auditable AI, we are the only company that maps AI-generated summaries to ground truth, helping providers quickly trust and verify the output. job_description_html:
Abridge was founded in 2018 with the mission of powering deeper understanding in healthcare. Our AI-powered platform was purpose-built for medical conversations, improving clinical documentation efficiencies while enabling clinicians to focus on what matters most—their patients.

Our enterprise-grade technology transforms patient-clinician conversations into structured clinical notes in real-time, with deep EMR integrations. Powered by Linked Evidence and our purpose-built, auditable AI, we are the only company that maps AI-generated summaries to ground truth, helping providers quickly trust and verify the output. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, we are setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.

We are a growing team of practicing MDs, AI scientists, PhDs, creatives, technologists, and engineers working together to empower people and make care make more sense.

The Role

As a user researcher at Abridge, you’ll play a pivotal role in informing how we build products that liberate healthcare professionals from clerical overhead, returning the focus to what’s important: excellent patient care.

Working closely with a multidisciplinary team of data scientists, engineers, clinicians, product managers, and product designers, you will immerse yourself in the workflows and needs of our key stakeholders, including doctors, nurses, administrators and patients, and distill key insights to pave a path forward for innovative product development.

What You'll Do

  • Conduct in-depth user interviews, on-site shadowing, and usability testing sessions to understand how doctors and other clinicians currently use Abridge, as well as their unmet needs and aspirations.

  • Synthesize your findings into actionable recommendations that guide the product vision and roadmap.

  • Collaborate with our client success team to monitor new product features and iterations, using a mix of qualitative and quantitative methods.

  • Explore insights, analytics & other output from our data science and machine learning researchers to validate your hypotheses and support your storytelling.

  • Partner with product management & design to translate findings into flows, wireframes, and prototypes that can be validated with end users.

  • Evangelize a user-centered design approach across the organization, building empathy and understanding for our users.

What You'll Bring

  • 5+ years of experience conducting user research to support digital product development, preferably in healthcare or a similarly complex domain.

  • Strong background in user research methodologies, from ethnographic studies to usability testing.

  • Excellent written & visual communication skills to turn research findings and their implications into compelling narratives and recommendations.

  • Tolerance for ambiguity and a love for collaborative exploration.

  • Passion for improving the healthcare experience for both patients and providers.

Bonus Points If…

  • You have experience with multimodal workflows (e.g. voice driven interfaces).

  • You are comfortable guiding discussions & research activities with executive stakeholders.

  • You feel comfortable assisting the product design team in a pinch, creating basic wireframes or prototypes, recommending copy, and participating in critiques.

Base Salary: $165,000 USD - $200,000+ USD per year + Equity

The salary range provided is based on transparent pay guidelines and is an estimate for candidates residing in the San Francisco and New York City metro areas. The actual base salary will vary depending on the candidate's location, relevant experience, skills, qualifications, and other job-related factors. Additionally, this role may include the opportunity to participate in a company stock option plan as part of the total compensation package.

Must be willing to work from our SF office at least 3x per week

This position requires a commitment to a hybrid work model, with the expectation of coming into the office a minimum of (3) three times per week. Relocation assistance is available for candidates willing to move to San Francisco.

Must be willing to travel up to 10%

Abridge typically hosts a 3 day builder team retreat every 3-6 months. These retreats often feature internal hackathons, collaborative project sessions, and social events that provide the team with opportunities to connect.

We value people who want to learn new things, and we know that great team members might not perfectly match a job description. If you’re interested in the role but aren’t sure whether or not you’re a good fit, we’d still like to hear from you.

Why Work at Abridge?

  • Be a part of a trailblazing, mission-driven organization that is powering deeper understanding in healthcare through AI!

  • Opportunity to work and grow with talented individuals and have ownership and impact at a high-growth startup.

  • Flexible/Unlimited PTO — Salaried team members can take off as much approved time off as they need, plus 13 paid holidays

  • Equity — For all salaried team members

  • Medical insurance — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 3 Aetna plans to choose from.

  • Dental & Vision insurance — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 2 Aetna plans to choose from.

  • Flexible Spending (FSA) & Health Savings (HSA) Accounts

  • Learning and Development budget — $3,000 per year for coaching, courses, workshops, conferences, etc.

  • 401k Plan — Contribute pre-tax dollars toward retirement savings.

  • Paid Parental Leave — 16 weeks paid parental leave, for all full-time employees

  • Flexible working hours — We care more about what you accomplish than what specific hours you’re working.

  • Home Office Budget — We provide up to $1,600 in a one-time reimbursement to set up your home office.

  • Sabbatical Leave — 30 days of paid Sabbatical Leave after 5 years of employment.

  • ...Plus much more!

Life at Abridge

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and helping each other be successful.

Diversity & Inclusion

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

Staying Safe - Protect Yourself From Recruitment Fraud

We are aware of individuals and entities fraudulently representing themselves as Abridge recruiters and/or hiring managers. Abridge will never ask for financial information or payment, or for personal information such as bank account number or social security number during the job application or interview process. Any emails from the Abridge recruiting team will come from an @ abridge.com email address. You can learn more about how to protect yourself from these types of fraud by referring to this article . Please exercise caution and cease communications if something feels suspicious about your interactions.

Compensation Range: $165K - $200K

Our enterprise-grade technology transforms patient-clinician conversations into structured clinical notes in real-time, with deep EMR integrations. * Synthesize your findings into actionable recommendations that guide the product vision and roadmap.
* Collaborate with our client success team to monitor new product features and iterations, using a mix of qualitative and quantitative methods.
* Explore insights, analytics & other output from our data science and machine learning researchers to validate your hypotheses and support your storytelling.

* Evangelize a user-centered design approach across the organization, building empathy and understanding for our users.

* Strong background in user research methodologies, from ethnographic studies to usability testing.
* Excellent written & visual communication skills to turn research findings and their implications into compelling narratives and recommendations.
* Tolerance for ambiguity and a love for collaborative exploration.
* Passion for improving the healthcare experience for both patients and providers.

## **Bonus Points If…**

* You have experience with multimodal workflows (e.g. voice driven interfaces).
* You are comfortable guiding discussions & research activities with executive stakeholders.

$165,000 USD - $200,000+ USD per year + Equity

The salary range provided is based on transparent pay guidelines and is an estimate for candidates residing in the San Francisco and New York City metro areas. The actual base salary will vary depending on the candidate's location, relevant experience, skills, qualifications, and other job-related factors. Additionally, this role may include the opportunity to participate in a company stock option plan as part of the total compensation package.

**Must be willing to work from our SF office at least 3x per week**

This position requires a commitment to a hybrid work model, with the expectation of coming into the office a minimum of (3) three times per week. Relocation assistance is available for candidates willing to move to San Francisco.

**Must be willing to travel up to 10%**

Abridge typically hosts a 3 day builder team retreat every 3-6 months. These retreats often feature internal hackathons, collaborative project sessions, and social events that provide the team with opportunities to connect.

We value people who want to learn new things, and we know that great team members might not perfectly match a job description. If you’re interested in the role but aren’t sure whether or not you’re a good fit, we’d still like to hear from you.

## **Why Work at Abridge?**

* Be a part of a trailblazing, mission-driven organization that is powering deeper understanding in healthcare through AI!
* Opportunity to work and grow with talented individuals and have ownership and impact at a high-growth startup.
* **Flexible/Unlimited PTO**
  — Salaried team members can take off as much approved time off as they need, plus 13 paid holidays
* **Equity**
  — For all salaried team members
* **Medical insurance**
  — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 3 Aetna plans to choose from.
* **Dental & Vision insurance**
  — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 2 Aetna plans to choose from.
* **Flexible Spending (FSA) & Health Savings (HSA) Accounts**
* **Learning and Development budget**
  — $3,000 per year for coaching, courses, workshops, conferences, etc.
* **401k Plan**
  — Contribute pre-tax dollars toward retirement savings.
* **Paid Parental Leave**
  — 16 weeks paid parental leave, for all full-time employees
* **Flexible working hours**
  — We care more about what you accomplish than what specific hours you’re working.
* **Home Office Budget**
  — We provide up to $1,600 in a one-time reimbursement to set up your home office.
* **Sabbatical Leave**
  — 30 days of paid Sabbatical Leave after 5 years of employment.
* ...Plus much more!

## **Life at Abridge**

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and helping each other be successful.

## **Diversity & Inclusion**

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

## **Staying Safe - Protect Yourself From Recruitment Fraud**

We are aware of individuals and entities fraudulently representing themselves as Abridge recruiters and/or hiring managers. Abridge will never ask for financial information or payment, or for personal information such as bank account number or social security number during the job application or interview process. Any emails from the Abridge recruiting team will come from an @
[abridge.com](http://abridge.com)
email address. You can learn more about how to protect yourself from these types of fraud by referring to
[this article](https://consumer.ftc.gov/consumer-alerts/2023/05/scammers-are-hijacking-job-ads-heres-how-spot-fakes)
. Please exercise caution and cease communications if something feels suspicious about your interactions.

Compensation Range: $165K - $200K

job_description_html:
Abridge was founded in 2018 with the mission of powering deeper understanding in healthcare. Our AI-powered platform was purpose-built for medical conversations, improving clinical documentation efficiencies while enabling clinicians to focus on what matters most—their patients.

Our enterprise-grade technology transforms patient-clinician conversations into structured clinical notes in real-time, with deep EMR integrations. Powered by Linked Evidence and our purpose-built, auditable AI, we are the only company that maps AI-generated summaries to ground truth, helping providers quickly trust and verify the output. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, we are setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.

We are a growing team of practicing MDs, AI scientists, PhDs, creatives, technologists, and engineers working together to empower people and make care make more sense.

The Role

Abridge is hiring a Product Manager - Platforms to define and build the technical platforms that power our user-facing products. This role will focus on developing the architecture and core technical assets for Abridge’s products, such as user authentication and management, APIs for integration with partners, etc. You will work closely with product, platform, and ML engineering teams to establish the technical foundations necessary for optimizing the Abridge product feature set, supporting integrations with technology partners, including healthcare providers and Electronic Health Record (EHR) vendors such as Epic, internationalization, and more. This position is critical for enabling Abridge’s technical platforms and products to scale to clinicians, patients, and all users being served in the US and beyond.

What You’ll Do

  • Define and lead Abridge’s platform product vision.

  • Collaborate with engineering to develop and refine secure, scalable APIs, prioritizing compatibility with healthcare systems like Epic EHR.

  • Create and maintain a secure, compliant user identity and data management repository.

  • Develop infrastructure supporting user account creation, authentication, and data integrity at the foundational stack level.

  • Act as a liaison between technical and product teams to integrate foundational components seamlessly into user-facing products.

  • Establish performance metrics for platform reliability and authentication, using data insights for continuous improvement.

  • Align platform strategy with industry standards and partner needs to support integration and compatibility.

  • Build user-focused authentication systems and data repositories to enable scalable, secure account management.

  • Ensure technical alignment with partner EHR systems for seamless enterprise client integration.

  • Design and deploy APIs and integration points with healthcare systems, enhancing technical compatibility with partners.

  • Work closely with platform and infrastructure teams to deploy essential technical components.

  • Partner with product managers, implementation, and client success teams to deliver solutions that meet user and client needs.

  • Serve as the primary product contact for technical inquiries on authentication and platform integrations, supporting team implementation.

What You’ll Bring

  • 5+ years of product management experience with technical focus and demonstrated contributions to  infrastructure, platform development, or API integrations.

  • Experience working closely with engineering teams to define, develop, and scale technical assets, ideally within SaaS technology environments (bonus for healthcare technology environments).

  • Familiarity with authentication protocols (e.g., OAuth, SAML), data management, and security best practices.

  • Expertise in API design and integration strategies, particularly for aligning technology with healthcare standards (experience with Epic or similar EHRs is a plus).

  • Strong technical acumen and ability to communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams, with a capacity for occasional hands-on technical contributions.

Bonus Points If…

  • Background in product management within a developer platform or technical infrastructure context

  • Experience in the healthcare or AI technology space, with an understanding of regulatory compliance and technical alignment for secure integrations

  • Knowledge of generative AI or machine learning platforms

Base Salary: $175,000 USD - $225,000+ USD per year + Equity

The salary range provided is based on transparent pay guidelines and is an estimate for candidates residing in the San Francisco and New York City metro areas. The actual base salary will vary depending on the candidate's location, relevant experience, skills, qualifications, and other job-related factors. Additionally, this role may include the opportunity to participate in a company stock option plan as part of the total compensation package.

Must be willing to work from our SF office at least 3x per week

This position requires a commitment to a hybrid work model, with the expectation of coming into the office a minimum of (3) three times per week. Relocation assistance is available for candidates willing to move to San Francisco.

Must be willing to travel up to 10%

Abridge typically hosts a three-day builder team retreat every 3-6 months. These retreats often feature internal hackathons, collaborative project sessions, and social events that allow the team to connect in person.

We value people who want to learn new things, and we know that great team members might not perfectly match a job description. If you’re interested in the role but aren’t sure whether or not you’re a good fit, we’d still like to hear from you.

Why Work at Abridge?

  • Be a part of a trailblazing, mission-driven organization that is powering deeper understanding in healthcare through AI!

  • Opportunity to work and grow with talented individuals and have ownership and impact at a high-growth startup.

  • Flexible/Unlimited PTO — Salaried team members can take off as much approved time off as they need, plus 13 paid holidays

  • Equity — For all salaried team members

  • Medical insurance — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 3 Aetna plans to choose from.

  • Dental & Vision insurance — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 2 Aetna plans to choose from.

  • Flexible Spending (FSA) & Health Savings (HSA) Accounts

  • Learning and Development budget — $3,000 per year for coaching, courses, workshops, conferences, etc.

  • 401k Plan — Contribute pre-tax dollars toward retirement savings.

  • Paid Parental Leave — 16 weeks paid parental leave, for all full-time employees

  • Flexible working hours — We care more about what you accomplish than what specific hours you’re working.

  • Home Office Budget — We provide up to $1,600 in a one-time reimbursement to set up your home office.

  • Sabbatical Leave — 30 days of paid Sabbatical Leave after 5 years of employment.

  • ...Plus much more!

Life at Abridge

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and helping each other be successful.

Diversity & Inclusion

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

Staying Safe - Protect Yourself From Recruitment Fraud

We are aware of individuals and entities fraudulently representing themselves as Abridge recruiters and/or hiring managers. Abridge will never ask for financial information or payment, or for personal information such as bank account number or social security number during the job application or interview process. Any emails from the Abridge recruiting team will come from an @ abridge.com email address. You can learn more about how to protect yourself from these types of fraud by referring to this article . Please exercise caution and cease communications if something feels suspicious about your interactions.

Compensation Range: $175K - $225K
job_description_md:
Abridge was founded in 2018 with the mission of powering deeper understanding in healthcare. Our AI-powered platform was purpose-built for medical conversations, improving clinical documentation efficiencies while enabling clinicians to focus on what matters most—their patients.

Our enterprise-grade technology transforms patient-clinician conversations into structured clinical notes in real-time, with deep EMR integrations. Powered by Linked Evidence and our purpose-built, auditable AI, we are the only company that maps AI-generated summaries to ground truth, helping providers quickly trust and verify the output. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, we are setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.

We are a growing team of practicing MDs, AI scientists, PhDs, creatives, technologists, and engineers working together to empower people and make care make more sense.

## **The Role**

Abridge is hiring a
**Product Manager - Platforms**
to define and build the technical platforms that power our user-facing products. This role will focus on developing the architecture and core technical assets for Abridge’s products, such as user authentication and management, APIs for integration with partners, etc. You will work closely with product, platform, and ML engineering teams to establish the technical foundations necessary for optimizing the Abridge product feature set, supporting integrations with technology partners, including healthcare providers and Electronic Health Record (EHR) vendors such as Epic, internationalization, and more. This position is critical for enabling Abridge’s technical platforms and products to scale to clinicians, patients, and all users being served in the US and beyond.

## **What You’ll Do**

* Define and lead Abridge’s platform product vision.
* Collaborate with engineering to develop and refine secure, scalable APIs, prioritizing compatibility with healthcare systems like Epic EHR.
* Create and maintain a secure, compliant user identity and data management repository.
* Develop infrastructure supporting user account creation, authentication, and data integrity at the foundational stack level.
* Act as a liaison between technical and product teams to integrate foundational components seamlessly into user-facing products.
* Establish performance metrics for platform reliability and authentication, using data insights for continuous improvement.
* Align platform strategy with industry standards and partner needs to support integration and compatibility.
* Build user-focused authentication systems and data repositories to enable scalable, secure account management.
* Ensure technical alignment with partner EHR systems for seamless enterprise client integration.
* Design and deploy APIs and integration points with healthcare systems, enhancing technical compatibility with partners.
* Work closely with platform and infrastructure teams to deploy essential technical components.
* Partner with product managers, implementation, and client success teams to deliver solutions that meet user and client needs.
* Serve as the primary product contact for technical inquiries on authentication and platform integrations, supporting team implementation.

## **What You’ll Bring**

* 5+ years of product management experience with technical focus and demonstrated contributions to  infrastructure, platform development, or API integrations.
* Experience working closely with engineering teams to define, develop, and scale technical assets, ideally within SaaS technology environments (bonus for healthcare technology environments).
* Familiarity with authentication protocols (e.g., OAuth, SAML), data management, and security best practices.
* Expertise in API design and integration strategies, particularly for aligning technology with healthcare standards (experience with Epic or similar EHRs is a plus).
* Strong technical acumen and ability to communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams, with a capacity for occasional hands-on technical contributions.

## **Bonus Points If…**

* Background in product management within a developer platform or technical infrastructure context
* Experience in the healthcare or AI technology space, with an understanding of regulatory compliance and technical alignment for secure integrations
* Knowledge of generative AI or machine learning platforms

**Base Salary: $175,000 USD - $225,000+ USD per year + Equity**

The salary range provided is based on transparent pay guidelines and is an estimate for candidates residing in the San Francisco and New York City metro areas. The actual base salary will vary depending on the candidate's location, relevant experience, skills, qualifications, and other job-related factors. Additionally, this role may include the opportunity to participate in a company stock option plan as part of the total compensation package.

**Must be willing to work from our SF office at least 3x per week**

This position requires a commitment to a hybrid work model, with the expectation of coming into the office a minimum of (3) three times per week. Relocation assistance is available for candidates willing to move to San Francisco.

**Must be willing to travel up to 10%**

Abridge typically hosts a three-day builder team retreat every 3-6 months. These retreats often feature internal hackathons, collaborative project sessions, and social events that allow the team to connect in person.

We value people who want to learn new things, and we know that great team members might not perfectly match a job description. If you’re interested in the role but aren’t sure whether or not you’re a good fit, we’d still like to hear from you.

## **Why Work at Abridge?**

* Be a part of a trailblazing, mission-driven organization that is powering deeper understanding in healthcare through AI!
* Opportunity to work and grow with talented individuals and have ownership and impact at a high-growth startup.
* **Flexible/Unlimited PTO**
  — Salaried team members can take off as much approved time off as they need, plus 13 paid holidays
* **Equity**
  — For all salaried team members
* **Medical insurance**
  — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 3 Aetna plans to choose from.
* **Dental & Vision insurance**
  — We pay 100% of the premium for you + 75% for dependents. 2 Aetna plans to choose from.
* **Flexible Spending (FSA) & Health Savings (HSA) Accounts**
* **Learning and Development budget**
  — $3,000 per year for coaching, courses, workshops, conferences, etc.
* **401k Plan**
  — Contribute pre-tax dollars toward retirement savings.
* **Paid Parental Leave**
  — 16 weeks paid parental leave, for all full-time employees
* **Flexible working hours**
  — We care more about what you accomplish than what specific hours you’re working.
* **Home Office Budget**
  — We provide up to $1,600 in a one-time reimbursement to set up your home office.
* **Sabbatical Leave**
  — 30 days of paid Sabbatical Leave after 5 years of employment.
* ...Plus much more!

## **Life at Abridge**

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and helping each other be successful.

## **Diversity & Inclusion**

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

## **Staying Safe - Protect Yourself From Recruitment Fraud**

We are aware of individuals and entities fraudulently representing themselves as Abridge recruiters and/or hiring managers. Abridge will never ask for financial information or payment, or for personal information such as bank account number or social security number during the job application or interview process. Any emails from the Abridge recruiting team will come from an @
[abridge.com](http://abridge.com)
email address. You can learn more about how to protect yourself from these types of fraud by referring to
[this article](https://consumer.ftc.gov/consumer-alerts/2023/05/scammers-are-hijacking-job-ads-heres-how-spot-fakes)
. Please exercise caution and cease communications if something feels suspicious about your interactions.

Compensation Range: $175K - $225K


[Apply for this Job](/Abridge/4e740f28-085b-4c70-a5cb-c876f21f6fa3/application)
